general.headline: Corporate Relations Team at Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay
general.school: IIT Bombay - Shailesh J. Mehta School of Management
general.description:
IIT Bombay established its management school in 1995 with the objective of transforming professionals with technological background to "Renaissance Leaders" of tomorrow.

Isolated expertise in functional areas of finance, systems, marketing or operations is giving way to a composite and unified approach to managing business processes.

Effective decision-making requires an integrated understanding of all business functions.

At the Shailesh J. Mehta School of Management, this guiding philosophy is firmly rooted in reality. Methodologies of business management are being shorn off the traditional practices and new holistic approaches are being developed.

These approaches are more at home with the issues that straddle the length and the breadth of ‘The Value Chain’. Today, the constantly changing business environment is characterized with many complex inter-related issues, which need to be addressed.

In such a scenario, the School believes that premium will be on professionals who are equipped to manage human intellect and imagination, on managers who can provide innovative solutions to problems and on executives who can deliver when required. Also the School espouses the belief that the use of technology would be invaluable in providing competitive strategies for overcoming all business challenges.

Team Rakshak is an IIT Bombay student initiative to develop a fleet of robust Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs) to support Search and Rescue Operations (SRO) in the event of disaster. These aircrafts can provide relief measures in disaster stricken area (e.g.: Landslide,Flood,Earthquake), can be used for surveys and mapping of cities and conservation of wildlife with slight modifications. Our design efficiently tackles the above problems in a cost effective manner without comprising on human safety.

Techfest is the annual science and technology festival of Indian Institute of Technology Bombay. It also refers to the independent body of students who organize this event along with many other social initiatives and outreach programs round the year. Techfest is known for hosting a variety of events that include competitions, exhibitions, lectures as well as workshops.
Started in 1998 with the aim of providing a platform for the Indian student community to develop and showcase their technical prowess, it has now grown into Asia's Largest Science and Technology Festival  with a footfall of 1.75 lakhs in its latest edition

jobs.jobTitle: Member of Lead Assessors Team for GreenCo Rating
jobs.description: About GreenCo Rating for Companies: Towards promoting ecological sustainability in industry, Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) has embarked on a journey to create a comprehensive rating system GreenCo, to assess performance of companies with respect to environmental impacts due to company operations in the entire value-chain. The GreenCo Rating System acts as a milestone for companies pursuing green initiatives to measure where they stand and help them in defining the path forward in achieving world class status in environmental sustainability. Companies get assessed on parameters such as energy efficiency, water conservation, renewable energy, GHG emission reduction, material conservation, recycling & recyclables, waste management, green supply chain, product stewardship, life cycle assessment, others (ventilation, site selection, innovation& biodiversity). The rating system thus, employs a holistic approach, wherein, it not only advises businesses on strategy and actions required but also provides mechanisms to quantify the impact of such actions and make course corrections if required.

Eco-portal Greenfeathers is essentially a meeting point, for all those interested in the environment domain whether looking for solutions or those having the know-how to offer solutions. It serves as a B2B, B2C and C2B platform while simultaneously showcasing the low carbon economy pioneers in India. Focus areas of environment sustainability include energy efficiency, clean technology, renewable energy, environment & climate change advisory, eco-design, eco-products and the overall clean and green sector. Includes modules - Green Directory, Green Events, Green Training and Green Jobs.

Greenfeathers Advisory Services: Our focus under Corporate Consulting is on sustainability issues to facilitate an organization's transition to a greener enterprise, more in tune with global standards supported by visionary approach towards the natural environment. Our emphasis is on guiding our clients organizational efforts towards the 'triple bottom line approach' dovetailing economic, social and environmental objectives within core business strategy. Our areas of expertise include energy efficiency, renewable energy, innovative technologies, green standards certification, GRI based sustainability reporting, carbon and ecological foot-printing, eco-restoration, green zone development, biodiversity studies, natural resources conservation, water harvesting and recycling among others. We also undertake market support activities of eco-products and eco-services on a case-to-case basis.

jobs.jobTitle: Event Coordinator at E-Cell, IIT Bombay
jobs.description:
The Entrepreneurship Cell is a non-profit organization run by the students of IIT Bombay that aims at manifesting the latent entrepreneurial spirit of the young students.

We at E-Cell host various workshops, speaker sessions, innovative games, competitions for aspiring entrepreneurs and support them by providing necessary resources such as seed funding, mentoring, consultancy and networking.

Initiatives
•E-Summit: The annual flagship event, a networking hub for corporates, professionals and budding entrepreneurs from all across the nation.
•Eureka!: Asia's largest B-Plan Competition as recognized by Thomson Reuters.
•National Entrepreneurship Challenge(NEC) - Created with the vision to promote entrepreneurship amidst all the campuses in India, National Entrepreneurship Challenge is the first of its kind pan-India competition undertaken by The Entrepreneurship Cell , IIT Bombay.
•EnB-Club: This new initiative aims to create an ecosystem for the budding entrepreneurs in the institute.

Conceptualizing and Executing brand integration strategies having a myriad target group(Students + Entrepreneurs + Corporates) for global and national corporations.

jobs.jobTitle: Campaign and Event Coordinator at Abhuday, IIT Bombay
jobs.description:
Abhyuday started 6 years back, with a group of socially inclined students who felt the need for a body, which provides opportunities to the students of the institute who wish to work for a better society. With a vision to channelize the youth towards India's social challenges, Abhyuday has established itself as one of the country’s largest student run social body in the mere span of 5 years.
Throughout the year Abhyuday organizes lectures, workshops, panel, conferences, blood donation camps and collaborated events with eminent social organizations. We aspire to promote social consciousness among the youth and concentrate their power towards a better and sustainable society.u
We connect youth and conduct year long activities to realize the changes, we as a society want to see those changes in the world.
We organize various competitions to empower youth of the country. Action-Plan (a social entrepreneurship competition), Kala-manch (online art competition), Adhikaar (debate competition) etc. are few of our competitions.
The Annual Social Festival inculcates various impactful events, exhibitions, lectures, workshops and competitions to instill a sense of responsibility in the youth towards the society and to create awareness about basic human rights.
As they say, “The most practical, beautiful, workable philosophy in the world won’t work- if you won’t”, Abhyuday IIT Bombay provides the young generation an opportunity to get involved in social work through fellowship program.

general.description: I am an experimental chemist. My research is devoted to have a better knowledge of the chemical and physical properties of materials for hydrogen purification membranes and solid state hydrogen storage. Mostly my research is related to development of inorganic membrane reactors for hydrogen production. Particularly, the interesting applications are hydrogen production and purification using Pd-alloy membrane and Zeolite based H2 permeable membranes. Part of my research is also focused on solid state storage of hydrogen isotopes using metal hydride. Recently, I expanded my interests towards catalyst to combine membrane and catalyst to produce and separate hydrogen in a single step. Hydrogen separation membrane and storage research is carried out by integration of inhouse developed membrane reactors and Severt's apparatus respectively.
